website_summaries.verdict: This vanilla-flavored, nondairy soft-serve mix is so popular, it's even found in Disneyland.
pros: Beloved by literally millions of people, as this brand is found in popular theme parks like Disneyland
One bag makes 2 gallons of soft serve
cons: It's nondairy, so it may not have the best taste

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this doesn't work the best in a small home soft serve ice cream maker. It tends to have a gel that plugs up the dispensing hole, so I end up scraping it out of the bowl, which sort of defeats the purpose of the soft serve. However, that aside. The flavor is good! My husband and I enjoy it. Just a tip, I have discovered that 1 scant cup of mix, 1 cup water and 1 cup milk works (since it doesn't give directions for small batches)
customer_reviews.author: Ooby

customer_reviews.title: No directions for small, personal ice cream maker- here's what works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had to guess how to mix this for a small personal use ice cream maker since the large package is apparently for commercial use. I have Cuisinart 1 1/2 Qt. Ice Cream maker and I used 2 cups of milk and 7/8 cup of mix. I stirred it to dissolve, then chilled the mix for 10 minutes, poured it in the frozen bowl mixer and it chilled perfectly and had great flavor. It says you can use milk or water, I will try water next time, but really enjoyed the milk and mix concoction.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Danielson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in the Cuisinart Ice45
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to try in the Cuisinart Ice45. Once I figured out the math, it was easy to use. Here's what I did. There's 3 pounds of product. I divided it to 6 portions of roughly 21 ounces and bagged them. Then add 2 2/3 cup of liquid, mix, then pour it in to the Cuisinart Ice 45. It says you can use milk or water. I tried milk and it came out very tasty. I made a batch yesterday using pineapple juice instead of milk or water and it was great. Going to try some with orange juice to try for that creamsicle taste.
customer_reviews.author: Godzilla62

customer_reviews.title: OUR FRIENDS AT AMAZON, KEEPS THEIR PROMISES!
customer_reviews.text: OUR FRIENDS AT AMAZON, KEEPS THEIR PROMISES! Thank you Friends at Amazon! For such clean fresh products, and on time! I am so thankful! Thank you Lord Christ!
customer_reviews.author: Min DK Sis.

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Cuisinart Soft Serve Machine
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to be used with my Cuisinart soft serve machine. I used 7/8 cup of mix with 2 cups of skim milk. It turned out very tasty and smooth. I saw on other reviews that they recommended whole milk, but I didn't have any at the time. I am looking forward to trying other flavors from Arctic Ice!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Works in the cuisinart machine
customer_reviews.text: Taste great, very creamy and works in the ice cream maker from cuisinart
customer_reviews.author: denise hartley

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, quality and great value
customer_reviews.text: I found Arctic Ice soft serve mix to be excellent in taste and texture. It compares favorably to the more expensive brands. A 3 pound bag for $16.00 makes 8 quarts of product. I've used it in both a compressor ice cream maker and old style (ice & rock salt) machine with good results. Arctic Ice may not be well known for home use. But it's the brand used by many major theme parks, including that famous mouse. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Chocolate flavor in commercial machine
customer_reviews.text: I had friends come over to taste test our soft serve ice cream. The vanilla was a hit but the chocolate was NOT! When I first put the mix into the machine the chocolate flavor was good, but as I served more it started to look paler. The flavor and color of the chocolate was dissipating. I love chocolate ice cream, but this was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Terhune

customer_reviews.title: The kids loved it!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy enough to mix and it froze perfectly in my commercial machine. The kids loved it, but I was hoping for something a little creamier. The flavor is not bad, it's just not as rich and vanilla as I had hoped. Would still purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Luther

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This product was gross. It tasted like nail polish remover smells. Don’t know if it was a bad batch or just bad in general.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa H.

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable product
customer_reviews.text: After waiting weeks for this product because it was 2 weeks late... It arrived damaged and I threw it away. My mailbox still smells like pineapple so now there are bees as well. NEVER AGAIN 😠
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Decent product easy to use. I suggest using milk for the vanilla, chocolate and strawberry for better flavor. Very pleased that I received the products before they were expected.
customer_reviews.author: labscientst

customer_reviews.title: Yummy
customer_reviews.text: Good flavor reminded me of growing up using the old ice cream machines and good flavor. Will order again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hodgdon

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my soft serve machine .... the taste was good but the texture was grainy
customer_reviews.author: mary simpson

customer_reviews.title: Not something I would give to a friend.
customer_reviews.text: Very much like frozen "Cool Whip". Very artificial appearance and taste, it resembled something I might use to repair drywall
customer_reviews.author: M. J. SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to use. Instructions were great. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Otremba

customer_reviews.title: Yummy and easy
customer_reviews.text: We make this in our home freezer. It works great. Just add water (or milk).
customer_reviews.author: Marlayne Harward

customer_reviews.title: difficult to compute measure for small unis
customer_reviews.text: The product was difficult to figure out. Once computed and mixed we found the taste was not as good as the recipe in the book. Threw out all but one batch (2 1/2 cups).
customer_reviews.author: cal kid

customer_reviews.title: Damaged material
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure as I did not use the product. I received it in a damaged box and the soft serve mix bag had a tear in it. I'm sure it would have been tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately very unpleasant. Never got smooth at all and smelled very ‘chemically’
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: Work in our home ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: Soft serve at home I use it in my home ice cream moker
customer_reviews.author: Hndimndn

customer_reviews.title: Taste great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Tasted really good. Easy to use. One negitive. No instructions on how to make smaller batches.
customer_reviews.author: R. Polcino

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting!!!
customer_reviews.text: Disgusting, had to toss it. Tastes like cheap hot chocolate.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Killingbeck

customer_reviews.title: Bad taste
customer_reviews.text: The taste is off. It tasted weird. Used different ways to mix it with water and milk and cream and all yielded a good product but the taste was off. Use the rest of it as a base for other flavors just to use the stabilizers in the mix. Used it on a compressor home ice cream machine.
customer_reviews.author: Gothic3n

customer_reviews.title: Flavorful
customer_reviews.text: Flavor is not bad at all, although texture can be ok the grainy side. Not bad to dislike though. Also use as flavoring for other baked goods and the flavor comes through!
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: AS EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: ARIVED ON TIME. KIDS ALL LIKED IT. IT WAS AS DISCRIBED.
customer_reviews.author: amom

customer_reviews.title: Have not used this yet
customer_reviews.text: I am assuming the taste will be ok, however a little over priced
customer_reviews.author: Lou Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Taste like old chapstick
customer_reviews.text: Taste like old chapstick, best description I could come up with. Does not even smell like pineapple :/ threw the entire batch out
customer_reviews.author: carly bonzi

customer_reviews.title: Taste is good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mix, i did one cup of mix and just shy of 3 cups milk.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: It’s good
customer_reviews.text: Love this mix!! It tasted great and was a hit when I made it.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Garcia

customer_reviews.title: NOT VEGAN as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product is not vegan as advertised. It contains milk! And it’s not eligible for return?!? That is insane. Might as well have flushed $16 down the toilet. Oh it was also spilling out of the bag when we opened it. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Jdaz

customer_reviews.title: Cottoncandy Milk
customer_reviews.text: Blended mix to powder and made syrup with water to make great cotton candy milk.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

product_meta.title: Brodys Soft Serve Mix, Vanilla 3 lb Bag
product_meta.description: Flavor:Vanilla 3lbArctic Ice Vanilla soft serve mix is a great tasting product found in amusement parks throughout the United States. Mixing instructions are included for use in at home Cuisinart Ice Cream.
feature_bullets: Found in popular theme parks like Disney
Mixing instructions are included on the bag
